senses.de: To change something to improve or make it more accurate.
senses.ex: She revised her paper for her final class project.

Tips.title: Improvement Focus
Tips.description: To revise means focusing on making something better or more accurate, not just making any change.
Tips.example: She revised her thesis to sharpen her argument.

Tips.title: Not Always Big Changes
Tips.description: Revisions can be minor, such as tweaking words for clarity, not only big alterations.
Tips.example: He revised the document’s wording for better flow.

Tips.title: Constructive Process
Tips.description: Think of revising as constructive criticism of your own work to reach perfection.
Tips.example: They revised their business proposal to ensure success.

senses.de: To read and correct or improve a piece of writing.
senses.ex: He revised his novel over a hundred times before publication.

Tips.title: Detailed Examination
Tips.description: When you revise a piece of writing, you examine every detail, not just the general idea.
Tips.example: He revised the article for grammatical errors.

Tips.title: Not Just Spelling
Tips.description: Revising includes checking the flow, style, and coherence of the text, not just spelling or grammar.
Tips.example: She revised her speech to improve its pacing.

Tips.title: Read Aloud Method
Tips.description: Reading your writing aloud is a technique for revising to catch errors you might otherwise miss.
Tips.example: He revised his report by reading it out loud.

senses.de: To study again something you have learned, especially for an exam.
senses.ex: Are you revising for the English exam?

Tips.title: Exam Preparation
Tips.description: Revising for exams means actively engaging with the material, not passive re-reading.
Tips.example: He revised his notes by creating flashcards.

Tips.title: Systematic Approach
Tips.description: Have a plan for revising, like focusing on weak subjects first or using practice tests.
Tips.example: She revised math by solving previous years' papers.

Tips.title: Mix Learning Methods
Tips.description: Use different techniques like summarizing, teaching others, or quizzing to revise effectively.
Tips.example: To revise history, he taught the key events to his friend.

Amend.wordDefinition:
Amend means to make a minor change or correction while the word revise means to make more significant changes or improvements.

For instance, if you have a paper that needs a few small changes like correcting grammar, punctuation, or spelling errors, you would amend the paper.

Amend is used when you make a small change or correction, while revise is used when you make significant or major changes.

Correct.wordDefinition:
Correct means to make something right or accurate.

It is typically used when there is an error or mistake in something and it needs to be fixed. For example, if there is a spelling mistake in an essay, you would correct it.

So, in short, correct is used to fix mistakes, while revise is used to make changes or improvements.

Edit.wordDefinition:
The main difference between edit and revise is their focus. Editing typically refers to the process of making small changes to improve the clarity, grammar, and style of a piece of writing.

For example, an editor might correct spelling errors or suggest better word choices to make a sentence more clear. A revision, however, might involve adding or deleting entire paragraphs to improve the flow of an essay or reorganizing the structure of a story to create a more compelling plot.

In short, editing focuses on fine-tuning the details, while revision involves making more substantial changes to improve the overall quality of a piece of writing.

Improve.wordDefinition:
Improve means to make something better, often by adding or enhancing its existing features. For example, if you want to improve your grades in school, you might study more or ask your teacher for extra help.

Improve is applicable when you want to enhance something that already exists, while revise is useful when you need to make changes to something to improve its quality or accuracy.

Modify.wordDefinition:
Modify refers to making small changes or adjustments to something, without completely overhauling it. Think of it like adding a few finishing touches to a project you've already completed.

Modify can be used when you need to make slight adjustments to something that is already good but needs some tweaking, while revise is more appropriate when you need to make bigger changes to improve something that is not quite up to standard.

Reconsider.wordDefinition:
Reconsider means to think again about something in order to make a new decision or judgment. It is applicable when you need to change your initial opinion or decision after giving it some more thought.

To summarize, you reconsider when you need to change your opinion or decision, and you revise when you need to change something you have already created or planned.

Rectify.wordDefinition:
Rectify means to correct or make something right that was wrong before. For example, if a student receives the wrong grade on an assignment and the teacher changes it to the correct one, the teacher has rectified the situation.

Rectify is used when something needs to be corrected or fixed, while revise is used when something needs to be improved or modified.

Refine.wordDefinition:
The difference between the words refine and revise is that refine means to improve, perfect or make something more precise, while revise means to make changes, corrections or improvements to something, typically written or oral material.

If you wanted to refine your writing, you would focus more on making it more polished, choosing just the right words and adjusting the details so that everything fits together and flows perfectly.

Revise is more focused on making changes or edits to something, while refine is more about making it better or more impressive in some way.

Rewrite.wordDefinition:
Rewrite means to completely redo something that has already been written, usually because it needs significant improvements, or because it's being adapted for a different purpose or audience.

Revise is appropriate when you want to improve an existing work by tweaking things here and there, while rewrite is more appropriate when the original work needs a complete overhaul in order to meet a new set of requirements or goals.

Update.wordDefinition:
Update means to make changes or improvements to something, but it is typically a smaller change. Updating something usually means making adjustments to keep it working properly or to make sure it's up-to-date.

A website might be updated regularly to keep it current with new information, but it wouldn't necessarily require a complete overhaul.

Revise is used when you want to make major changes while update is used when you want to make small changes or keep something current.

quotes.Text: The government should help and guide the weak and small racial groups within its national boundaries toward self-determination and self-government. It should offer resistance to foreign aggression, and simultaneously, it should revise foreign treaties in order to restore our equality and independence among the nations.
quotes.Title: Chinese Leader
quotes.Name: Sun Yat-sen

quotes.Text: Students often have such a lofty idea of what a poem is, and I want them to realize that their own lives are where the poetry comes from. The most important things are to respect the language; to know the classical rules, even if only to break them; and to be prepared to edit, to revise, to shape.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Yusef Komunyakaa

quotes.Text: I keep an elaborate calendar for my characters detailing on which dates everything happens. I'm constantly revising this as I go along. It gives me the freedom to intricately plot my story, knowing it will at least hold up on a timeline.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Maria Semple

quotes.Text: When you put your characters in a dire situation, they often do things that surprise even you, so you have to go back and revise your original conception of who they are.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Hallie Ephron

quotes.Text: Awareness requires a rupture with the world we take for granted; then old categories of experience are called into question and revised.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Shoshana Zuboff

quotes.Text: Revising stuff lately, I was shocked to see how often my characters scratched their ankles, felt their feet, and touched their own ears.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Elizabeth McCracken

quotes.Text: When I create a character, it happens in layers. The more I write and revise, the better I understand the characters.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Susan Campbell Bartoletti

quotes.Text: I revise obsessively. It's important to me to have a clean page.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Wentworth Miller

quotes.Text: It's never too late - in fiction or in life - to revise.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Nancy Thayer

quotes.Text: I don't want to help a politician revise the truth.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Terry Gross
